name: Sorting and Summing
description:
You will write a program that takes 2 arrays of equal length integers as arguments.
The program must compare each element from the same index and add the highest of the 2 elements to a sum called assigned `highest`. It must also add the lowest of the 2 elements to a sum assigned `lowest`.

If both the elements being compared are the same value, nothing is added to either `highest` or `lowest`.

The program must return the highest and lowest sums respectively in an array (not a tuple).

## Exceptions
if the 2 arrays are not equal in length the program should return `"error"`.

## Examples

- `sortNsum([1,5,3,2], [7,3,7,3])` --> `[22 ,9]`
- `sortNsum([10,1,3,4], [1,8,2,2])` --> `[25 ,6]`
- `sortNsum([1,2,3,4], [4,3,2,1])` --> `[14 ,6]`
- `sortNsum([1,2,2,2],[3,2,2,1])` --> `[5, 2]`
- `sortNsum([1,2,2,2],[3,2,2])`, `"error"`
